description:
Available Now : Displays attendees bookmarked events, 
            Can directly link from events to agenda
            
            Available in December: 
            ICS 'add to calendar' functionality

Avaliable Now: Dynamically generated from the actual users attending the event. Users can enter the following info into their profile (viewable by other attendees)Profile image, Short Biography,Company, Title, Email (can be different from account email),Telephone, Meeting Link (for user supplied Zoom, Calendly, etc.), Social Media Profile Link: Facebook, Youtube, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, Privacy Opt Out - hides their profile from other attendees. Note: If user does not fill in their profile they do not appear.

Available Now: 
            This room means different things to different clients: for example  meeting room where client's executives, engineering etc. meet with clients (invitation only), or meeting room dedicated to networking by invitation, by interests etc. 
            Note: third party video chat solutions are supplied by clients (example Zoom)

Available Now: 
            This room means different things to different clients: for example  meeting room where client's executives, engineering etc. meet with clients (invitation only), or meeting room dedicated to networking by invitation, by interests etc. 
            Note: third party video chat solutions are supplied by clients (example Zoom)

Available Now: 
            The booth generator offers 'Small', 'Medium', or 'Large' booths with various options. 
            Unlimited attached PDF resources.
            'Fishbowl' feature 
            One or two videos (depending on booth size)
            Optional 'company information' text .
            Optional 'Live meeting' link to client supplied meeting platform. 
            Optional 'vCard' or pfd. contact information
            Optional 'booth chat.' 
            Upgrade to AR experience for additional fee. 
            This booth size: Small.

Available Now:
            Flexible: Customers have flexibility to choose SSO or any email account. 
            Secure: Single Sign On - authentication method to log into our platform using their company's set of credentials. 
            Four Required Fields - First Name, Last Name, Email and Password. First and Last Name carried over to the platform. 
            Custom data fields: Additional 9 fields (required or optional) – text field, drop down, radial, check mark, multiple choices. See slide notes for additional details. 
            Registration confirmation email: optional.

Available Now: 
            This page usually allows for a speaker image, name, bio, social media link, time of presentation. 
            
            It is always manually created and is not connected to an attendee profile in anyway. 
            
            It can have any information a client wishes. 
            
            Note: Many times the speakers do not 'attend' the event and don't have user accounts, this info is typically manually entered

Available Now.
            For On Demand Videos only. 
            Text Only, Single or Multiple Choice.
            
            Charge professional services to create quizzes and surveys.

Available Now: 
            Broadcasting capabilities means working with our live production team.
            Producer works to facilitate the virtual equivalent of a live in-person on- stage event or TV news broadcast-equivalent presentation.
            Producers serve as the same people or event staff that the client would interact with in a large in-person event. Usually, the technicians that would be sitting behind the drape line or at the Tech Table at the front of the room ballroom. Example: audio engineer, video engineer etc. 
            Due to virtual nature, multiple in-person positions  can be filled by a single producer based upon event scale/complexity. 
            Each concurrent stream to Inferno requires 1 Producer charged at the below rate. This could be a General Session, or a breakout room streamed to a player/event page.
            Minimum 15-minute break required between events. 
            Example: 1 main stage that splits into 3 concurrent breakouts without a break would require 4 producers.
